Message.Issue: In method 'Alias.Load()', call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object 'reader' before all references to it are out of scope.
In method 'Alias.Save()', object 'writer' is not disposed along all exception paths. Call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object 'writer' before all references to it are out of scope.
'AsyncRunner' contains field 'AsyncRunner.resetEvent' that is of IDisposable type: 'ManualResetEvent'. Change the Dispose method on 'AsyncRunner' to call Dispose or Close on this field.

In method 'ObjImporter.CreateMeshStruct(string)', object 'stream' is not disposed along all exception paths. Call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object 'stream' before all references to it are out of scope.

In method 'ObjImporter.populatMeshStruct(ref ObjImporter.meshStruct)', object 'stream' is not disposed along all exception paths. Call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object 'stream' before all references to it are out of scope.

Rule.Name: Disposable fields should be disposed
Rule.Description: If a type that implements IDisposable owns fields that also implement IDisposable, the encapsulating type's Dispose() implementation should call Dispose() on each disposable field.
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains field {1} that is of IDisposable type: {2}. Change the Dispose method on {0} to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Rule.Name: Dispose objects before losing scope
Rule.Description: If a disposable object is not explicitly disposed before all references to it are out of scope, the object will be disposed at some indeterminate time when the garbage collector runs the finalizer of the object. Because an exceptional event might occur that will prevent the finalizer of the object from running, the object should be explicitly disposed instead.
Rule.Resolution: In method {0}, object {1} is not disposed along all exception paths. Call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object {1} before all references to it are out of scope.
In method {0}, call System.IDisposable.Dispose on object {1} before all references to it are out of scope.
